action.content:
Provide one single-word clue that relates to some of your team's words from the list below. You can choose to how many and to which words your clue relates to.
The goal is to have your partner guess all of your team's words based on the clues you give them, before the other team has uncovered all of theirs. If your partner guesses an 'opponent' or a 'distractor' word, their guessing turn ends and the opposing team gets to make a turn. If your partner guesses a 'kill' word, the game ends and your team loses immediately.
The more words your clue relates to, the quicker you can win the game, but the harder the associations may be to guess for your partner, so choose your clue word wisely. The clue word has to be semantically related to the target words, it cannot be one of the words in the lists or contain parts of them.

Always give your single-word clue and your comma-separated list of related target words in the following format and make your answers as short as possible, never include any other text than is required in this form:

CLUE: <WORD>
TARGETS: <TARGETS>

Your team words are: ring, telescope, spine, thief, scale, wall, figure, ham, fighter.
Your opponent's team words are: angel, dragon, france, scorpion, deck, dinosaur, bottle, whip.
Distractor words are: field, wind, europe, watch, snow, shop, lock.
The kill words are: pin.
action.label: context

action.content:
<think>
Okay, let's see. I need to come up with a single-word clue that relates to some of my team's words: ring, telescope, spine, thief, scale, wall, figure, ham, fighter. The clue can't be one of the words themselves or part of them. Let me think about possible connections.

First, "ring" makes me think of a circular object, maybe a ring in boxing? But "fighter" is also a team word. So maybe "boxing"? But does that connect to others? Let's check. "Fighter" definitely. "Ham" could be a slang term for an actor, but not sure. "Thief" might be part of a boxing context? Not really. Maybe "ring" as in the boxing ring. But how about other words?

"Telescope" is an instrument. "Scale" could be a musical scale or a weighing scale. "Spine" is part of the body. "Wall" is a structure. "Figure" could be a number or a person. "Ham" as in the meat or acting. "Fighter" again, maybe a fighter jet? Hmm.

Another angle: "Scale" could relate to a balance or a scale in music. "Telescope" and "wall" might be parts of a building? Not sure. "Spine" is part of the body. Maybe "backbone"? But "spine" is already a team word. Wait
action.label: response

content.message: Your answer contained more than two lines, please only give one clue and your targets on two separate lines.
